[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships_v2] [Non-Transferrable Flag] Can non_transferrable_by_owner be bypassed through indirect transfer mechanisms? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_ownerships_v2] [Fungible Amount Manipulation] For is_fungible_v2 tokens, can amount (Numeric) overflow or be negative, enabling token duplication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_pending_claims] [Claim Expiration] Is there any expiration mechanism for pending claims, or can stale claims block token transfers indefinitely? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_pending_claims] [Amount Mismatch] Can the amount field be manipulated to claim more tokens than were offered? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_pending_claims] [From/To Address Validation] Can from_address or to_address be null or invalid, causing claim resolution failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_v2_metadata] [Resource Type Confusion] Can resource_type (128 char limit) be manipulated to associate wrong metadata types with token objects? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_v2_metadata] [Data JSON Corruption] The data field (Jsonb) stores arbitrary metadata - can malicious JSON cause parsing errors or data corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: current_token_v2_metadata] [State Key Hash Uniqueness] Is the combination of object_address and resource_type unique, or can duplicate metadata entries cause confusion? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: delegated_staking_activities] [Event Type Validation] The event_type field is Text - can arbitrary event types be inserted, bypassing staking activity validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: delegated_staking_activities] [Amount Manipulation] Can negative amount values be stored for stake/unstake events, corrupting activity history? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: delegated_staking_activities] [Event Index Uniqueness] Does the composite key prevent duplicate event processing that could double-count staking activities? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: delegated_staking_pool_balances] [Historical Balance Corruption] Can historical balance records be modified to hide past stake mismanagement or theft? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: delegated_staking_pool_balances] [Commission Historical Manipulation] Can historical operator_commission_percentage be altered to hide commission changes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: events] [Event Replay] Does the composite key (account_address, creation_number, sequence_number) prevent duplicate event insertion that could enable event replay attacks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: events] [Event Data Corruption] The data field (Jsonb) stores arbitrary event data - can malicious event payloads cause processing errors or injection attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: events] [Event Index Nullability] The event_index is Nullable - can missing event indices cause event ordering issues or loss of event sequencing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: events] [Type Field Injection] The type_ field is Text with no length limit - can excessively long type strings cause storage or query performance issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: indexer_status] [Status Manipulation] Can is_indexer_up be manipulated to hide indexer failures, causing applications to rely on stale data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: indexer_status] [Database Identifier] The db field is limited to 50 characters - can identifier collisions cause status confusion across multiple indexers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: ledger_infos] [Chain ID Validation] Does the schema enforce valid chain_id values, or can invalid/conflicting chain IDs be stored causing network confusion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: ledger_infos] [Single Field Table] With only chain_id field, is additional ledger metadata missing that could cause synchronization issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: move_modules] [Bytecode Nullability] The bytecode field is Nullable Bytea - can NULL bytecode cause module execution failures or indicate corrupted module storage? (High)
[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: move_modules] [Module Deletion Flag] Can is_deleted be false for deleted modules, allowing calls to non-existent code? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: move_modules] [Exposed Functions Corruption] The exposed_functions (Jsonb) field - can malicious JSON corrupt function signatures, causing invocation errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/indexer/src/schema.rs] [Table: move_modules] [Struct Definition Injection] The structs (Jsonb) field - can injected struct definitions cause type confusion or deserialization exploits? (Medium)
